history.content:
I will check your schedule and let you know if any of the courses work. Since we share the breadth list with Letters and Sciences and it is their faculty who make the determination, there is not a petition process. Every new class is reviewed and the faculty decide if it will fulfill any of the breadth requirements. The College of Engineering allows courses from the approved Letters and Sciences breadth lists, except for the Physical and Biological Sciences lists. Also remember that the course must be at least 3 units to satisfy the H/SS requirement. 

- Olivia

So I was wondering if a few classes I'm enrolled are counted towards the H/SS requirement. 
I booked an appointment with my ESS advisor, but it is on Thursday.
What is a good way to figure this out? 

Also is it possible to petition a class to be counted as a H/SS?
history.subject: Classes count towards the H/SS requirement?
